page.title: 10THE CLEDDAU BRIDGE, BURTON
page.content: The deep estuary of Milford Haven and small inlet of Westfield Pill made the journey from {Neyland to Pembroke 28 miles; so the County Council gave permission for two bridges to be built. Now the journey is only a few miles. Before the bridges were built, a ferry from{Burton to Pembroke}was run, but that did not provide a 24 hour service which the bridges do. The{Cleddau Bridge}was opened on the {23rd May 1975}by the Secretary of State for Wales John Morris and a party of children from{Burton V.C. {School}were invited to the opening ceremony.
